capability_questions.question: Enroll Provider Does enrollment process meet state and federal regulations or policies? automatic? and submit the application? use standards in the process? process?

levels.level_1: and accurately. The process consists primarily of manual paper-based activity to accomplish tasks. Applicant completes application on paper and submits via facsimile, in person, or mail. SMA focuses on meeting compliance thresholds for state and federal regulations using state-specific standards. Very little collaboration occurs with other agencies to standardize information exchange or business tasks.
levels.level_2: applications timely and accurately. Enroll Provider SMA uses a mix of manual and automatic processes to accomplish tasks. Enroll Provider Applicant may use state standardized paper application but also has choices of data entry at government offices and kiosks. Electronic submissions are available and used. SMA applies a mix of HIPAA and state- specific standards. Enroll Provider SMA collaborates with other agencies and entities to adopt HIPAA standards and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) transactions.
levels.level_3: applications enrollment timely and accurately including one-stop collaboration across SMA. SMA automates process to the full extent possible within the intrastate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, enrollment standard messages, and national standards within the intrastate that use standardized business rules definitions for consistent enrollment Provider Network information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA produces audit trail of enrollment decision 100% of the time. Applicants may complete and submit nationally standardized electronic application from any location that has internet access. Multiple intrastate programs, including Medicaid, Medicare, and CHIP conduct dual-eligibility determination. SMA adopts MITA Framework, standard enrollment interfaces, and other nationally recognized enrollment standards for intrastate enrollment assignment and exchange of information. SMA collaborates with other intrastate agencies and entities to adopt national standards and to develop and share reusable business services.
levels.level_4: SMA automates the enrollment process to the extent possible within the region. SMA adopts MITA Framework, enrollment standard messages, and national standards within the region that use a regional standardized business rules definitions for consistent enrollment Provider Network information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA shares Meaningful Electronic Health Record information with the Registration and Attestation (R&A) System. SMA shares business services across interstate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, standard enrollment interfaces, and other nationally recognized enrollment standards for clinical and regional exchange of enrollment assignment information. SMA collaborates with other regional agencies and entities to adopt national standards and to develop and share reusable enrollment assignment processes including clinical information.
levels.level_5: SMA automates the enrollment process to the extent possible across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, enrollment standard messages, and national standards nationally that use a national standardized business rules definitions for consistent enrollment Provider Network information is shared with Health Insurance Marketplace (HIX). SMA shares Meaningful Electronic Health Record information with the R&A System. SMA shares business services across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, standard enrollment interfaces, and other nationally recognized enrollment standards for national exchange of enrollment assignment information. SMA collaborates with national agencies and entities for national (and international) interoperability improvements that maximize automation of routine enrollment assignment operations.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Timeliness of Process
capability_questions.question: How timely is the end-to-end process?

levels.level_1: mandated requirements for timeliness (i.e., the process achieves results within the time specified by law or regulation).
levels.level_2: of automation. Timeliness exceeds legal requirements. Enroll Provider
levels.level_3: collaboration, use of enrollment assignment information sharing, standards, and regional information exchange hubs. Timeliness exceeds Level 2.
levels.level_4: information is available in near real time. SMA has regional interoperability, which further improves timeliness over Level 3.
levels.level_5: information is available in real time. Processes improve further through connectivity with other States and with federal agencies. Most processes execute at the point of service. Results are almost immediate.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Data Access and Accuracy
capability_questions.question: How accurate is the information in the process? the process?

levels.level_1: collection is manually intensive and susceptible to inconsistent or incorrect information. Stakeholders are unable to rely on information for decision-making. SMA stores information in disparate systems including paper storage and obtains information manually.
levels.level_2: accuracy of information but the decision-making process may be erroneous or misleading. Accuracy is higher than at Level 1. Enroll Provider SMA stores information in disparate systems, but automation and HIPAA standards increase accessibility over Level 1.
levels.level_3: assignment information increasing the reliability of SMAâ€™s internal information. External sources of enrollment assignment information use MITA Framework and industry standards for information exchange. Decision- making is automatic using standardized business rules definitions. Accuracy rating is at 99% or higher. SMA obtains enrollment assignment information easily and exchanges with intrastate agencies and entities based on MITA Framework and industry standards. Enrollment reports on the status of entire Medicaid population in graphical format for management use. Accessibility is greater than Level 2.
levels.level_4: assignment information increasing the reliability of regional sources of information. SMA adopts MITA Framework and industry standards or information exchange by regional agencies. Decision-making is automatic using regional standardized business rules definitions. Accuracy rating is at 99% or higher. SMA obtains enrollment assignment information easily and exchanges with regional agencies and entities. Accessibility is greater than Level 3.
levels.level_5: industry standards for national information exchange. Decision- making is automatic using national standardized business rules definitions. Accuracy rating is at 99% or higher. SMA obtains enrollment assignment information easily and exchanges with national agencies and entities. Accessibility is greater than Level 4.

capability_questions.question: What is the cost of the process compared to the benefits of its results?

levels.level_2: resolution, improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 1.
levels.level_3: assignment standard messages, and other nationally recognized enrollment assignment standards further improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 2.
levels.level_4: assignment standard messages, and other nationally recognized enrollment assignment standards for regional information exchange improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 3.
levels.level_5: assignment standard messages, and other nationally recognized enrollment assignment standards for national (and international) information exchange. SMA increases cost effectiveness ratio over level 4.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Effort to Perform; Efficiency
capability_questions.question: How efficient is the process?

levels.level_1: Process is labor intensive. There is wasted effort or expense to accomplish tasks. Process meets minimum state process guidelines and SMA performance standards. Efficiency is low.
levels.level_2: Automation and state standards increase productivity. Efficiency is higher than Level 1. Enroll Provider
levels.level_3: SMA adopts MITA Framework and enrollment assignment standard messages with intrastate agencies and entities improving efficiency to 95% or higher.
levels.level_4: SMA adopts MITA Framework and enrollment assignment standard messages with regional agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: SMA adopts MITA Framework and enrollment assignment standard messages with national agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Data Access and Accuracy
capability_questions.question: How accurate are the results of the process?

levels.level_1: opportunity for human error. Accuracy is low.
levels.level_2: business rules definitions reduce error and improve accuracy above Level 1.
levels.level_3: enrollment assignment standard messages with intrastate agencies and entities improving accuracy to 90% or higher.
levels.level_4: enrollment assignment standard messages with regional agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: enrollment assignment standard messages with national agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Utility or Value to Stakeholders
capability_questions.question: Does the business process satisfy stakeholders?

levels.level_1: information negatively affecting stakeholder satisfaction with the process.
levels.level_2: provides clear and useful information. Stakeholder satisfaction is greater than Level 1. Enroll Provider
levels.level_3: enrollment assignment standard messages with intrastate agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 90% or higher. SMA uses survey or questionnaire for information collection.
levels.level_4: enrollment assignment standard messages with regional agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 95% or higher.
levels.level_5: enrollment assignment standard messages with national agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 98% or higher.
